item.title: 宝马确认 2025 年展望，预计部分汽车关税将从 7 月起下降
item.description: 德国高档汽车制造商宝马公司（BMW）周三确认了其2025年的发展前景，并表示预计对汽车进口征收的部分关税将从7月份开始下降，这是该公司对汽车行业前景较为乐观的看法之一。【原文：German premium carmaker BMW on Wednesday confirmed its 2025 outlook, saying it expected some of the tariffs that have been imposed on vehicle imports to decline from July in one of the more optimistic views on the industry's prospects.】

item.title: 罗格朗概述了抵消潜在 2 亿美元关税相关成本的行动计划
item.description: 法国电气和数字楼宇基础设施集团罗格朗（Legrand）首席执行官贝努瓦-科卡特（Benoît Coquart）告诉路透社记者，该集团将提高价格、调整供应链并冻结支出，以抵消美国对中国进口商品加征关税造成的高达2亿美元的成本。【原文：French electrical and digital building infrastructure group Legrand will hike prices, adjust supply chains and freeze spending to offset up to $200 million in costs from U.S. tariffs on Chinese imports, CEO Benoît Coquart told Reuters.】

item.title: 肥胖症药物制造商诺和诺德下调 2025 年展望，第一季度利润高于预期
item.description: 肥胖症药物生产商诺和诺德公司周三因美国处方数据低迷而下调了全年销售和利润展望，但公布的第一季度营业利润高于分析师预测。【原文：Obesity drugmaker Novo Nordisk on Wednesday cut its full-year sales and profit outlook amid lacklustre U.S. prescription data and posted first-quarter operating profit above analyst forecasts.】

item.title: 宝马确认 2025 年前景，预计部分汽车关税将是暂时性的
item.description: 德国高档汽车制造商宝马公司（BMW）周三确认了其2025年的展望，称其预计对全球汽车进口征收的部分关税将是暂时的，并将从7月份开始下降。【原文：German premium carmaker BMW on Wednesday confirmed its 2025 outlook, saying it expected some of the tariffs that have been imposed on vehicle imports globally to be temporary and decline from July.】

item.title: 奥希伍德致梅尔-吉布森：从特朗普的电影关税中拯救我们
item.description: 澳大利亚电影业希望演员梅尔-吉布森（Mel Gibson）能像他在动作英雄电影中所做的那样，说服美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）放弃可能会摧毁其 10 亿澳元（约合 6.5 亿美元）好莱坞业务的电影关税，从而拯救世界。【原文：Australia's film industry wants actor Mel Gibson to do what he does in his action-hero movies and save the day, by convincing U.S. President Donald Trump to drop his film tariffs which could devastate its A$1 billion ($650 million) Hollywood business.】

item.title: 三菱汽车签署谅解备忘录，将电动车型开发外包给富士康部门
item.description: 日本汽车制造商三菱汽车公司（Mitsubishi Motors）周三表示，该公司已与富士康子公司 Foxtron Vehicle Technologies 就供应一款电动车型签署了一份谅解备忘录。【原文：Japanese automaker Mitsubishi Motors has signed a memorandum of understanding with Foxconn subsidiary Foxtron Vehicle Technologies for the supply of an electric vehicle model, it said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 欧洲 美国和中国正向贸易谈判迈进，但达成协议似乎遥遥无期
item.description: Tom Westbrook 展望欧洲和全球市场的未来一天【原文：A look at the day ahead in European and global markets from Tom Westbrook】

item.title: 据英国《金融时报》报道，亚马逊的 Zoox 将扩大机器人出租车的生产规模，向美国扩张
item.description: 据英国《金融时报》周三报道，亚马逊的自动驾驶初创公司Zoox将于明年扩大生产规模，加快在美国商业化推广其机器人出租车队的计划。【原文：Amazon's self-driving start-up Zoox will scale up production next year as it accelerates plans for a commercial rollout of its fleet of robotaxis in the U.S., the Financial Times reported on Wednesday.】

item.title: 混合动力车需求支撑丰田盈利，但美国关税冲击迫在眉睫
item.description: 尽管投资者将高度警惕美国关税影响的任何迹象，但在丰田公司周四公布年度收益报告时，对混合动力汽车的强劲需求预计将支撑其稳定的利润。【原文：Robust demand for hybrids is expected to underpin steady profits at Toyota when the world's top automaker reports annual earnings on Thursday, although investors will be on high alert for any sign of a looming impact from U.S. tariffs.】

item.title: 消息人士称，CATL 可能为 50 亿美元的香港上市提供低于 10% 的折扣
item.description: 据三位直接知情人士透露，中国电池巨头 CATL 拟在香港上市融资约 50 亿美元，其潜在投资者已被告知，该公司股票可能会以低于深圳上市股票 10% 的折扣出售。【原文：Prospective investors in Chinese battery giant CATL's Hong Kong listing to raise about $5 billion have been told the stock may be sold at a discount of less than 10% to the company's Shenzhen-listed shares, according to three sources with direct knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: 中国贸易沙皇成为美国关税谈判的焦点
item.description: 中国国家主席习近平的长期亲信何立峰将于周六与美国官员举行会谈，旨在打破世界前两大经济体之间的贸易僵局。【原文：Opposite U.S. officials for talks on Saturday aimed at breaking a trade deadlock between the world's top two economies will be He Lifeng, a longtime confidant of Chinese President Xi Jinping who has slowly cultivated a reputation as a key fixer.】

item.title: 美联储会议前美元走低，亚洲货币趋于平静
item.description: 周三，在美联储召开会议决定对不确定的经济采取何种政策之前，美元汇率趋于稳定，亚洲的主要投资者继续从美国资产中套现。【原文：The dollar steadied on Wednesday before a Federal Reserve meeting to determine policy for an uncertain economy and as major investors in Asia continued cashing out of U.S. assets.】

item.title: 据 The Information 报道，OpenAI 计划削减对微软的收入分成
item.description: 据 The Information 周二报道，OpenAI 已告知投资者，它将与微软分享较小部分的收入。【原文：OpenAI has told investors it will share a smaller fraction of revenue with Microsoft , The Information reported on Tuesday.】

item.title: 监管机构称中国资本市场面临美国关税压力
item.description: 中国证监会主席周三表示，美国的关税政策给中国资本市场带来了巨大压力，将有力推动长期资金进入股市。【原文：The head of China's securities regulator said on Wednesday that U.S. tariff policy has brought great pressure to China's capital markets and will forcefully promote long-term capital into the stock market.】

item.title: SK 集团董事长崔龙洙就 SK 电讯公司大规模数据泄漏事件道歉
item.description: SK 集团董事长崔泰源周三就韩国最大的移动运营商 SK 电讯公司（SK Telecom）发生大规模数据泄露事件道歉，该事件引起了 2300 万用户对个人和财务信息可能被盗的担忧。【原文：SK Group Chairman Chey Tae-won apologised on Wednesday for a massive data leak at South Korea's largest mobile carrier, SK Telecom, which has caused concern among its 23 million users over the possible theft of personal and financial information.】

item.title: 中国央行下调 7 天期逆回购利率，5 月 8 日起生效
item.description: 中国央行周三表示，将降低七天期逆回购协议的借贷成本，在与美国贸易紧张局势加剧的情况下，中国政府加大了货币宽松政策的力度，以支持整体经济。【原文：China's central bank said on Wednesday it would lower the borrowing cost of its seven-day reverse repurchase agreements, as Beijing stepped up monetary easing to support the broad economy in the face of intensifying trade tensions with the United States.】

item.title: 中国央行在美国贸易会议前放宽政策
item.description: 中国央行行长周三提出了降息和向银行系统注入流动性等货币政策宽松措施，旨在减轻与美国的贸易战所带来的影响。【原文：China's central bank governor on Wednesday flagged interest rate cuts and a liquidity injection into the banking system, among other monetary policy easing measures aimed at mitigating the impact of a trade war with the United States.】

item.title: 特斯拉在美国推出 Model Y 长距离后轮驱动汽车
item.description: 特斯拉网站周二显示，特斯拉已在美国推出 Model Y 长距离后轮驱动车型，定价为 44,990 美元。【原文：Tesla has launched its Model Y Long Range Rear-Wheel drive in the U.S., pricing it at $44,990, its website showed on Tuesday.】

item.title: 美国期货因中国贸易谈判而反弹
item.description: 周三，美国股指期货反弹，亚洲货币上涨，因为投资者对中美两国贸易高官将于周末在瑞士举行会晤的消息表示欢迎，认为这是缓和贸易战的一个机会。【原文：U.S. stock futures bounced and Asian currencies rose on Wednesday, as investors welcomed news of a meeting between top U.S. and Chinese trade officials, set for the weekend in Switzerland, as a chance to tone down the trade war.】

item.title: 新西兰就业增长放缓，工资通胀加剧了更多降息押注
item.description: 新西兰第一季度的就业增长速度疲软，失业率维持在 4 年半以来的低点附近，工资通胀也有所放缓，这进一步加强了人们对本月晚些时候以及全年降息的预期。【原文：New Zealand's employment grew at a soft pace in first quarter with the jobless rate holding around 4-1/2-year lows and wage inflation moderating, reinforcing bets for more interest rate cuts later this month and throughout the year.】

item.title: 欧洲和中国需求增加、美国产量减少的迹象导致石油上涨
item.description: 周三，油价上涨，原因是有迹象表明美国产量减弱，欧洲和中国的需求增加，在本周早些时候油价跌至新低后出现了买家。【原文：Oil prices rose on Wednesday on signs of weakening production in the U.S. and higher demand in Europe and China as buyers emerged after prices fell to new lows earlier in the week.】

item.title: 巴西法官阻止贷款机构 BRB 签署收购 Banco Master 的协议
item.description: 根据路透社看到的一份法院命令，巴西法官周二阻止国营银行巴西商业银行（BRB）签署从同业银行 Banco Master 收购资产的最终合同。【原文：A Brazilian judge on Tuesday blocked state-run bank BRB from signing the definitive contract to buy assets from fellow lender Banco Master, according to a court order seen by Reuters.】

item.title: 澳大利亚监管机构在麦格理银行合规失败后对其展开进一步打击
item.description: 澳大利亚证券和投资委员会（ASIC）周三对麦格理集团旗下的麦格理银行的澳大利亚金融服务执照施加了附加条件，理由是该银行存在大量严重的合规违规行为。【原文：The Australian Securities and Investments Commission (ASIC) on Wednesday imposed additional conditions on the Australian financial services licence of Macquarie Bank, owned by Macquarie Group , citing numerous serious compliance failures.】

item.title: 英国官员：美英贸易协定取得进展
item.description: 一位英国官员周二表示，美国和英国在贸易协议谈判方面取得了良好进展，该协议可能包括降低钢铁和汽车关税配额，但由于美国财政部长斯科特-贝森特（Scott Bessent）和美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）发出的信号相互矛盾，协议达成的时间仍然存疑。【原文：The U.S. and Britain have made good progress in negotiating a trade deal that would likely include lower tariff quotas on steel and autos, a UK official said on Tuesday, but the timing of a deal remains in doubt amid conflicting signals from U.S. Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent and President Donald Trump.】

item.title: 大华银行第一季度净利润同比稳定，低于预期
item.description: 新加坡大华银行（United Overseas Bank）周三公布的第一季度净利润为 14.9 亿新元（11.6 亿美元），与去年同期持平，主要原因是手续费收入创历史新高，贷款增长强劲。【原文：Singapore's United Overseas Bank reported on Wednesday S$1.49 billion ($1.16 billion) in net profit for the first quarter, flat from a year earlier, due to factors including record fee income and robust loan growth.】

item.title: 美国参议员宣布两党推动改变美联储监督机构的遴选方式
item.description: 两位参议员周二宣布了一项立法，将改变美联储内部监察机构的遴选方式。【原文：Two senators announced legislation on Tuesday that would change how the Federal Reserve’s in-house watchdog is selected.】

item.title: 银行退出，私人信贷公司盯上香港房地产新基金
item.description: 随着估值下降和银行减少风险敞口，一些私人信贷公司正在介入投资香港的大型商业地产和开发商，并计划在全球最昂贵的房地产市场之一发行新基金。【原文：As valuations fall and banks pare exposure, some private credit firms are stepping in to invest in large commercial properties and developers in Hong Kong with plans for new fund launches for one of the world's most expensive real estate markets.】

item.title: 美国参议员调查泰森食品公司工厂使用童工的指控
item.description: 美国参议员乔希-霍利（Josh Hawley）周二表示，他对泰森食品公司展开了调查，因为该肉类公司的一名前雇员指控有儿童在该公司的一家加工厂工作。【原文：U.S. Senator Josh Hawley said on Tuesday he launched an investigation into Tyson Foods after a former employee of the meat company alleged that children worked at one of its processing plants.】

item.title: 澳大利亚国民银行上半年现金收益增长 1
item.description: 澳大利亚最大的商业银行澳大利亚国民银行（National Australia Bank）周三表示，受贷款量增长和减值费用降低的影响，上半年现金收益增长了 1%。【原文：National Australia Bank , the country's biggest business lender, said on Wednesday its first-half cash earnings rose 1%, helped by growth in lending volumes and lower impairment charges.】

item.title: 贝森特和格里尔本周将在瑞士会见中国官员
item.description: 美国财政部长斯科特-贝森特（Scott Bessent）和美国贸易代表贾米森-格里尔（Jamieson Greer）周二表示，他们将于本周晚些时候在瑞士会见中国最高经济官员，这标志着就唐纳德-特朗普总统的关税攻击进行的潜在谈判迈出了第一步。【原文：U.S. Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent and U.S. Trade Representative Jamieson Greer will meet with China's top economic official later this week in Switzerland, the two U.S. agencies said on Tuesday, marking an initial step in potential negotiations over President Donald Trump's tariff assault.】
